Column Comment.0: SUPPORT FACILITY SUBTYPE: The type of support facility that is described by thisrow of data. These values are managed by check constraint, and may only be thename of a valid sub type of support facility.
Column Comment.1: SUPPORT FACILITY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a support facility, such as arig.
Column Comment.2: RIG EQUIPMENT COMPONENT ID: Identifier forl the equipment that is included onthe rig, such as the engines, generators, mud pumps, drawworks, mast, substructure,traveling block, swivel, rotary table, blowout preventor, blowout preventor closingunitsetc.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: EQUIPMENT CATALOGUE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the list of kinds ofequipment. Think of this as a catalogue or brochure that shows all the kinds ofequipment that you may use, but may or may not actually have. Actual peices ofequipmentthat exist are defined in the table EQUIPMENT. Use this table to define themake and model number of a piece of equipment without identifying the specificpiece of equipment.
Column Comment.5: COMPONENT COUNT: The number of components of this type that is described inthis row of data. For example, if there are three mud pumps that are the same modeland make, you can define all three in the same record. If the mud pumps are not thesame model and make, and you need to capture that information, you need to storeone row for each make and model.
Column Comment.6: DESCRIPTION: Narrative descrption of the equipment.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.8: EQUIPMENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a specific peice of equipment.
Column Comment.9: EQUIPMENT NAME: the common name assigned to this piece of equipment, in theevent it has a name. If you are using the EQUIPMENT tables, please capture thisinformation in the EQUIP ALIAS table.
Column Comment.10: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.11: INSTALL DATE: the date that this piece of equipment was installed in or on thesupport facility.
Column Comment.12: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.13: PURCHASE DATE: Where you are NOT using the EQUIPMENT tables, you maystore the purchase date here. Otherwise, please use the EQUIPMENT module tocapture this information.
Column Comment.14: EQUIPMENT REFERENCE NUMBER: A reference number that is assigned toequipment, particularly if that number is not the same as the serial number. If you areusing the EQUIPMENT Tables, please capture this information in EQUIP ALIAS.
Column Comment.15: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.16: REMOVE DATE: The date that this piece of equipment was removed from thesupport facility.
Column Comment.17: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.18: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.20: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.22: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
